Many European countries mandate a minimum number of paid vacation days, while the US doesn't have any federal law requiring paid time off. This means that many Americans end up with very little vacation time, if any at all.

It's important to note that this isn't just about the number of days; it's also about the culture surrounding vacation time. In some countries, taking time off is seen as a right and a necessity for maintaining a healthy work-life balance. In the US, there can be a stigma attached to taking vacation, with some people feeling pressured to work even when they are supposed to be off.
